extendedIngredients.name: red bell peppers
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 large organic red bell peppers, cut into large chunks

extendedIngredients.name: mahi mahi
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 1/2 lbs Mahi Mahi, diced, or any firm fish

extendedIngredients.name: onions
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 large onions, cut into large chunks

extendedIngredients.name: tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 large tomatoes, sliced into big chunks

recipes.title: Caribbean fish

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Tiamo Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 8 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Tiamo Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Light straw yellow color. Fresh and rich fruity aromas of apple and pear with a hint of citrus fruit that fade into the floral bouquet. Fresh and fruity, very clean and crisp.Tiamo Pinot Grigio pairs well with a wide array of lighter cuisine, especially fish/shellfish, poultry, pastas in cream sauce and softer cheeses. It's also an ideal aperitif.

recipes.instructions: In alarge heavy pot,heat the olive oil over medium to high heat. Add all the ingredients except the fish.Bring the mixture to a rapid boil, then lower the flame a bit and let it cook for 15 minutes to reduce the sauce and cook the veggies. You may have to stir once or twice. Add the fish and cook further for 10 minutes until the fish is fully cooked. Don't stir too much of the fish will brake. Turn heat off when fish is cooked through and serve over brown rice.

steps.step: In alarge heavy pot,heat the olive oil over medium to high heat.

Add all the ingredients except the fish.Bring the mixture to a rapid boil, then lower the flame a bit and let it cook for 15 minutes to reduce the sauce and cook the veggies. You may have to stir once or twice.
Add the fish and cook further for 10 minutes until the fish is fully cooked. Don't stir too much of the fish will brake. Turn heat off when fish is cooked through and serve over brown rice.
